# CapiscIO Documentation

> Complete documentation for CapiscIO - The Universal Authority Layer for AI Agents. Learn to validate A2A agent cards, add cryptographic identity with Trust Badges, and enforce security with the Gateway sidecar.

CapiscIO solves the critical problem that agent cards can pass schema validation but fail in production. The CLI validates both cryptographic authenticity AND protocol compliance. The SDK provides enforcement-first security middleware.

## Quickstarts

- [Validate Your Agent](https://docs.capisc.io/quickstarts/validate/1-intro/): Validate A2A agent cards in 5 minutes using the CLI
- [Secure Your Agent](https://docs.capisc.io/quickstarts/secure/1-intro/): Add cryptographic identity with SimpleGuard (zero-config middleware)
- [CI/CD Integration](https://docs.capisc.io/quickstarts/cicd/1-intro/): Automate validation in GitHub Actions with quality gates

## Installation

```bash
# CLI via npm (Node.js wrapper around Go binary)
npm install -g capiscio

# CLI via pip (Python wrapper around Go binary)
pip install capiscio

# Python SDK (runtime security middleware)
pip install capiscio-sdk
```

## Key Terms

- A2A Protocol: Agent-to-Agent protocol v0.3.0 by Google for AI agent interoperability
- Agent Card: JSON file at /.well-known/agent.json describing agent capabilities, endpoints, and authentication
- Trust Badge: VC-aligned JWS token (X-Capiscio-Badge header) serving as agent identity passport
- JWS: JSON Web Signature (RFC 7515) for cryptographic message/card integrity
- Body Hash (bh): SHA-256 hash claim in JWS for payload integrity verification
- SimpleGuard: Zero-config Python class that auto-generates Ed25519 keys and enforces identity/integrity/freshness
- Gateway: Reverse proxy sidecar that blocks requests without valid Trust Badges
- Compliance Score: 0-100 measuring A2A protocol adherence
- Trust Score: 0-100 measuring cryptographic security posture
- Availability Score: 0-100 measuring endpoint health (requires --test-live)

## What You Get With SimpleGuard

1. Zero-Config Identity: Auto-generates Ed25519 keys and agent-card.json on first run
2. Payload Integrity: Enforces SHA-256 body hash verification, blocks tampered payloads (403)
3. Replay Protection: Strict 60-second token expiration, prevents replay attacks
4. Performance: <1ms overhead with Server-Timing headers for monitoring
